required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: German Multicentre Registry to Evaluate the Technical Feasibilty of Epicardial Collateral Connections in CTO PCI

collaborator.agency: University Heart Center Freiburg - Bad Krozingen

brief_summary.textblock: The EPIC registry is an observational multicentre registry evaluating the technical feasibility of retrograde CTO-PCI using epicardial collateral connections. It will evaluate the frequency, effectiveness, safety and outcomes of patients who underwent CTO-PCI using this approach. The EPIC registry retrieves data from CTO centres across Germany.

detailed_description.textblock: The EPIC registry is the first German-wide observational multicentre registry evaluating the technical feasibility, clinical success and safety of retrograde CTO-PCI using epicardial collateral connections. The EPIC registry retrieves data from CTO centres across Germany. All patients will be followed-up to 30 days after inclusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of technically successful retrograde CTO-PCI using epicaridal collaterals
primary_outcome.description: defined as the rate of successful CTO-PCI with reestablished antegrade coronary flow (thrombolysis in myocardial infarction (TIMI) flow III) with less than residual stenosis of 50%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of clinically successful retrograde CTO-PCI using epicaridal collaterals
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success is defined as the rate of successful CTO-PCI by technical success without MACCE and without major periprocedural complications, including pericardial tamponade and contrast induced dialysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of failed retrograde CTO-PCI using epicaridal collaterals
secondary_outcome.description: is defined as the rate of CTO-PCI without technical success defined as residual stenosis >50% (by visual estimation) and TIMI flow grade <3 after CTO-PCI.

intervention.intervention_name: Retrograde Percutaneous Coronary Intervention of Chronic Total Occlusion
intervention.description: Retrograde CTO-PCI using epicardial collateral connections

study_pop.textblock: EPIC will observationally evaluate all patients undergoing retrograde CTO-PCI using epicardial collateral connections during daily clinical practice from German CTO centres.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing retrograde CTO-PCI using epicardial collateral connections during daily clinical practice.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None.
